Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery lekane; white slip; interior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (only part of head remaining) to left; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of goat's horn to right, with part of pendant triangle and dotted circle as filling ornament.
Producer name: Attributed to: Painter of the Aphrodite Bowl
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the Aphrodite Bowl 1888,0601.456.
Bibliographic references: Williams 2006a / The Chian Pottery from Naukratis (p.128 fig.4-5, no.25)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2055) (phase 2)
